verses.text: Better \add is\add* the poor that walketh in his integrity , than \add he that is\add* perverse in his lips , and is a fool.
Also, \add that\add* the soul \add be\add* without knowledge , \add it is\add* not good ; and he that hasteth with \add his\add* feet sinneth.
The foolishness of man perverteth his way : and his heart fretteth against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Wealth maketh many friends ; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.
A false witness shall not be unpunished , and \add he that\add* speaketh lies shall not escape.\f + \fr 19.5 \ft unpunished: Heb. held innocent\f* \p
Many will intreat the favour of the prince : and every man \add is\add* a friend to him that giveth gifts.\f + \fr 19.6 \ft him…: Heb. a man of gifts\f*
All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth \add them with\add* words , \add yet\add* they \add are\add* wanting \add to him\add*.
He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul : he that keepeth understanding shall find good.\f + \fr 19.8 \ft wisdom: Heb. an heart\f*
A false witness shall not be unpunished , and \add he that\add* speaketh lies shall perish.
Delight is not seemly for a fool ; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
The discretion of a man deferreth his anger ; and \add it is\add* his glory to pass over a transgression.\f + \fr 19.11 \ft discretion: or, prudence\f*
The king’s wrath \add is\add* as the roaring of a lion ; but his favour \add is\add* as dew upon the grass.
A foolish son \add is\add* the calamity of his father : and the contentions of a wife \add are\add* a continual dropping.
House and riches \add are\add* the inheritance of fathers : and a prudent wife \add is\add* from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep ; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul ; \add but\add* he that despiseth his ways shall die.
He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; and that which he hath given will he pay him again.\f + \fr 19.17 \ft that which…: or, his deed\f*
Chasten thy son while there is hope , and let not thy soul spare for his crying.\f + \fr 19.18 \ft for…: or, to his destruction: or, to cause him to die\f*
A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment : for if thou deliver \add him\add*, yet thou must do it again.\f + \fr 19.19 \ft do: Heb. add\f*
Hear counsel , and receive instruction , that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
\add There are\add* many devices in a man’s heart ; nevertheless the counsel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that shall stand.
The desire of a man \add is\add* his kindness : and a poor man \add is\add* better than a liar.
The fear of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add tendeth\add* to life : and \add he that hath it\add* shall abide satisfied ; he shall not be visited with evil.
A slothful \add man\add* hideth his hand in \add his\add* bosom , and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
Smite a scorner , and the simple will beware : and reprove one that hath understanding , \add and\add* he will understand knowledge.\f + \fr 19.25 \ft will beware: Heb. will be cunning\f*
He that wasteth \add his\add* father , \add and\add* chaseth away \add his\add* mother , \add is\add* a son that causeth shame , and bringeth reproach.
Cease , my son , to hear the instruction \add that causeth\add* to err from the words of knowledge.
An ungodly witness scorneth judgment : and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.\f + \fr 19.28 \ft An…: Heb. A witness of Belial\f*
Judgments are prepared for scorners , and stripes for the back of fools.
